atomica.objects
Class Settings

java.lang.Object
  atomica.objects.Settings
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
EditorSettings, GameSettings
public abstract class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

Abstract class holding all necessary settings for the initialization of a game situation. This includes the board size, the levels and a base factor for score calculation. Since it can be defined in two modes - by the game settings itself or by the editor there are two subclasses: EditorSettings and GameSettings. The main difference consists in their initialization.

Author:
Georg Ludewig

getLevel

public Level getLevel(int index)
Returns the Level for the given index. The index must be greater than 0 since it represents the level number where the first starts with 1.

getPreferences

protected abstract java.util.prefs.Preferences getPreferences()
Abstract method for getting the preferences for retrieving and storing the settings in user directory. Since EditorSettings and GameSettings have their own preferences this method is to override.

Returns:
the preferences where to store the settings in user directory
